thread.title: 'Urban mining' in South Korea makes money from waste

title: 'Urban mining' in South Korea makes money from waste
text:
'Urban mining' in South Korea makes money from waste 1:41am BST - 01:09 
As China’s aggressive hunt for overseas cobalt and lithium for electric vehicles pushes up prices and causes a global shortage of the key metals, South Korea is increasingly turning to such “urban mining” to recover cobalt, lithium and other scarce metals from electronic waste. Grace Lee reports. ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript 
As China’s aggressive hunt for overseas cobalt and lithium for electric vehicles pushes up prices and causes a global shortage of the key metals, South Korea is increasingly turning to such “urban mining” to recover cobalt, lithium and other scarce metals from electronic waste.
